5.2a.definition: A financial system where a central bank controls the processing of payments and transactions
The protection of personal or sensitive information from being accessed by unauthorized users
Converted into a secure code so it can't be read by others
A secure version of the HTTP protocol used to protect information on websites
A small file stored on your device that remembers your details for future visits
A special type of digital currency that uses encryption and works without central control

5.2b.definition: A decentralised database where each transaction is stored with a timestamp and linked to the previous one
Units that contain data about a transaction, a unique code (called a hash), and a link to the previous block
A unique fingerprint created by an algorithm like SHA-256
The exact time and date the block was created
The very first block in a blockchain, which does not link to any previous block
A method that requires a fixed amount of time and effort before a new block can be added
Network participants who verify transactions and add new blocks in exchange for a reward
